definition: local bus or train/slow train with many stops
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The lorry was travelling at 20mph in the slow lane.
sentences.chinese: 卡车在慢车道上以20英里的时速行驶。

sentences.english: Only slow trains stop at that station.
sentences.chinese: 那个站只有慢车才有停靠。

sentences.english: The boy followed them all the way in his car.
sentences.chinese: 男孩一路开着慢车跟着他们。

sentences.english: Make sure that the engine 1 and 2 throttle control levers are at idle.
sentences.chinese: 确保1号发动机和2号发动机的油门杆在慢车位。

sentences.english: This is a good quality highway, and very wide.
sentences.chinese: 这是一条很初级的慢车道，并且很宽。

sentences.english: I moved into the slow lane, next to the dreaded edge, and swept around the terrifying curve.
sentences.chinese: 我开进了慢车道，紧挨着崖边转过了令人心惊的急弯。

sentences.english: Are you driving in the slow lane?
She eventually showed up, tiny little dust cloud behind her oh-so-slow cart.
sentences.chinese: 她终于出现，微小的尘埃云她身后啊那么慢车。

sentences.english: He caught the slow train to Birmingham.
sentences.chinese: 他赶上去伯明翰的慢车。

sentences.english: Let's rediscover life in the slow lane.
sentences.chinese: 让我们在慢车道上去重新发现生活吧。

sentences.english: Above the crowd I hear the clang of a crossing signal as a slow train rolls along the tracks.
sentences.chinese: 越过人群，我听到一辆慢车驶过道口时的的信号声。

definition: green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to give right of way to another vehicle
